page.title: 10Housing - Shelton Lock,Derby
page.content: 300 years ago only one house stood in Shelton Lock, then in the early 20th century houses spread along the main roads followed by a huge increase of housing because of the development of Rolls Royce and the railways.There is about every kind of housing but mostly bungalows, modern terraces and detached houses. The land was mostly fields before the houses were built. There are a few warden controlled flats, an old people's home next to Shelton Junior school and a children's home nearby. An OAP welfare centre is in some new houses next to the Bridge Inn. Because of the expansion of Derby there are a lot of new houses and flats being built here.
